results.title: The Bounty
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, De Laurentiis Entertainment Group, Bernard Williams and Roger Donaldson
results.brief_description: A re-telling of the famous conflict between Captain Bligh and Mr. Fletcher Christian aboard the ship “The Bounty”. The conflict eventually led to a mutiny against Bligh, led by Christian, and to Bligh’s miraculous escape in an open boat across 4,000 miles of ocean. Featuring beautiful Pacific locations and a star-studded cast including Daniel Day Lewis, Edward Fox and Laurence Olivier. Mel Gibson plays Christian. But it is Anthony Hopkins’ portrayal of Bligh which is most memorable and he makes the Captain a believably human character rather than the monster he is usually portrayed as. Music by Vangelis. The script is by Robert Bolt based on the book “Captain Bligh and Mr Christian” by Richard Hough.

results.title: The Bottom Rung
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rich World Poor World”.
This program reports from Bangladesh, Tanzania and Brazil and highlights the extreme poverty there. It poses the question ‘Can the gap between rich world and poor world ever be closed?’

results.title: The Bostonians
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Merchant Ivory Productions and Ismail Merchant
results.brief_description: A Merchant Ivory adaptation of Henry James’ novel in which the young, but charismatic Verena is forced to choose between her loyalty to the women’s suffragette movement, represented by her mentor, Olive (Vanessa Redgrave), and the passionate attention of Olive’s cousin (Christopher Reeve) who represents everything that Olive abhors. Ruth Prawer Jhabvala adapted the novel for the screen and the film co-stars Linda Hunt and Jessica Tandy.

results.title: The Boston strangler
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Robert Fryer and Richard Fleischer
results.brief_description: Based on a true story this 70’s thriller is a powerful and horrifying police drama. It follows the story of the hunt for a serial killer who has raped and murdered dozens of women in the Boston area. Rapists and sexual offenders are dragged from the street to undergo interrogation in the hope of finding the killer. Disturbing and tense this film is extremely well acted, and uses the then fashionable multi-image technique. A docudrama that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Cast includes Tony Curtis, Henry Fonda, Hurd Hatfield and George Kennedy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Robert Fryer and Richard Fleischer

group_works.title: People are the main part of any deal

results.title: The Borrowers. Series II
results.creator_credit: Working Title Films, Grainne Marmion and John Henderson
results.brief_description: The Clock family, Pod, Homily and Arietty are beginning to find living with their “Borrower” relatives a strain, particularly with the return of Ditchly and Ilrick, Aunt Lupy’s two obnoxious and evil sons. The Clocks, and their friend Spiller, make a dangerous journey to find a new home in the model village of Little Fordham. Can they survive the cruel tricks of Ditchly and Ilrick, and manage to avoid capture by the evil Mrs. Driver? With the help of their “giant” friend George, and their own resourcefulness, the Borrowers experience many adventures down drains, in boats and balloons. Excellent special effects make this video a special treat for young and old.

results.title: The Borrowers
results.creator_credit: Working Title Films, Grainne Marmion and John Henderson
results.brief_description: Based on Mary Norton’s classic novels, we step into the miniature world of the Clock family - Pod, Homily and their daughter Arietty. Living under floorboards, in secret corners of the house, they “borrow” everything they need from “giant” human beings. Their greatest fear is is to be “seen”. Arietty is bored with the life of confinement, and longs to go outside , despite the terrible story about the fate of her cousin Eggletina. When Pod teaches her to borrow, Arietty enters the wide world and encounters two sorts of humans - George, her schoolboy friend, and Mrs. Driver, the evil housekeeper. This production has excellent special effects and is a delight to watch.

results.title: The Borders: where Scotland and England meet
results.creator_credit: Edinburgh Film Productions, Robin Crichton and Mike Pavett
results.brief_description: Examines the agricultural and industrial development of the border regions of Scotland and England, and the growth of new houses and educational institutions. Highlights projects which have been implemented to attract population and encourage young people to stay instead of seeking careers and employment elsewhere.
